item.description: New cell phone case, new man
item.author: rscaletta

item.description:
Love it when you need to go to the doctor, and insurance decides that this isn’t stressful enough, so they’ll just tell you that the entire physician network is not in-network when it’s always been in-network and you can check their online provider database but it’s literally more than a year out of date. Great feeling to find an in-network doctor and and find out he left for a different practice last year.

Anthem #InsuranceIsGreat
item.author: rscaletta

item.description: Email might just be the single best invention of the computer age.
item.author: rscaletta

item.description: “Neidermeyer! I thought you were dead?”
item.author: rscaletta

item.description:
OK, so 3rd-party Twitter clients are officially banned, so let’s go over (just a few) of the problems with the official Twitter app:

  1. This blue bubble shows up whenever someone posts a new tweet—which, of course, happens all the time. If you tap it, it jumps all the way to the top of the list (the latest tweets) with no way to go back. This is pointless because on a standard iPhone app you just tap the top of the screen to go to the top. The blue bubble blocks content and there’s no way to get rid of it.

  2. This big plus button is for making a new tweet. It covers your content and it’s HUGE, bigger than the toolbar at the bottom or the top. No way to get rid of it.

  3. All of this junk means there’s only room to see 1 tweet completely. Sheesh.

  4. The “For you/Following” bar is permanently at the top of the screen. Unlike the account/twitter icon bar, it doesn’t slide away when you scroll down and get out of the way. This app sure loves to steal UI space, doesn’t it? This bar should auto-hide somehow at the very least. Better, it shouldn’t be there at all—the “For you” tab is terrible, and isn’t the point of Twitter to see accounts you’re “Following?”

  5. This one is not so bad because it slides out of the way. But the big twitter logo does nothing, and your account avatar opens a secret side menu with a bunch of extra options and views. I’d make the twitter icon on the left and make it open the menu. Your avatar should link to your profile. You could also stick something else up here, like the stupid new tweet button.

  6. What is this icon for? Why is it in one of the most prominent places in the UI?

Lots more going on here, but that’s enough for now!
item.author: rscaletta

item.description: How many times do I have to tell Instagram I’m not interested in somebody reposting grainy, cropped NFL highlight videos with idiotic captions like, “That time Justin Herbert dropped 62 yards EYES EMOJI?”

item.description: Am I to believe “The Burbs” is currently the most popular thing on Netflix?
item.author: rscaletta

item.description:
I’m assuming that twitter decided they don’t want to allow 3rd party clients any more. Honestly, I’m surprised it took this long for them to make a decision! But why couldn’t they just make an actual announcement and maybe give a date when the API would be cut off?

Of course then I remembered who’s in charge over there…

item.author: rscaletta

item.description:
Went to a Pacers game! Pacers won!

Halftime show was dogs catching frisbees! Excellent! Made me wonder—why do we have to pay for tickets to a basketball game to see a dog show? Don’t people just want to see the dog show?
item.author: rscaletta

item.description: Love calling for warranty service on my SharkNinja vacuum cleaner then seeing targeted ads for Ninja frying pans
item.author: rscaletta

item.description:
OK, I have “completed” the home-grown replacement for the twitter.com website. It’s basically just a list of twits (a twit-list), if you will. I did rig it to support more than one account, but let’s be real, I’m the only one who will write anything.

Again, I don’t post anything to twitter for other people to read, instead I post stuff that I will get a chuckle out of if I read it again in 3 months.

Got it!

item.description: Sample pictures! Include the class and lightbox tags for compatibility with the gallery system.
item.author: rscaletta

item.description:
This is an example post by Lizz. To make another one, copy this file and edit the contents. Make sure you keep the Author:lizzscaletta line in it somewhere (doesn’t have to be the first line, but it’s convenient).

After saving the text file, double-click the “Upload to Server” icon.

The updated page should be visible at https://scaletta.org/twit-list.
item.author: lizzscaletta

item.description: Seems like the entire cooling duct is clogged with ice so we had to completely empty the fridge and now we’re letting it thaw. Maybe it will work tomorrow?
